SMW Subobject for NormalHigh Alchemy value: 600Examine: Halo with the protection of Armadyl.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Armadyl haloUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Armadyl halo.pngWeight: 0.300Value: 1000Version anchor: NormalRelease date: 29 August 2019Item ID: 24192

The Armadyl halo is an item worn in the head slot that can be bought from Justine's stuff for the Last Shopper Standing for 450 Last Man Standing points. It acts as an Armadyl item, and thus prevents Armadylean followers from attacking its wearer in the God Wars Dungeon.

The defensive bonuses of the halo are similar to those of a black full helm, excluding negative attack bonuses and Ranged defence bonus. In addition, the halo gives a prayer bonus and magic defence while the full helm does not.

If the player dies below level 20 Wilderness, it will remain in the player's inventory. However, the item will be unusable and must be repaired with 25,000 coins by using the item on Perdu. If not protected when the player dies above level 20 Wilderness, the item is converted into coins and dropped. Alternatively, a Trouver parchment and a payment of 500,000 coins can be given to Perdu in order to lock it (after which it gains the (l) suffix); this allows the item to be kept in death, unbroken, even if the player dies at level 20 Wilderness or higher.

[[File:Armadyl halo chathead.png|left]]
The '''Armadyl halo''' is an item worn in the head slot that can be bought from [[Justine's stuff for the Last Shopper Standing]] for 450 [[Last Man Standing]] points. It acts as an [[Armadyl]] item, and thus prevents Armadylean followers from attacking its wearer in the [[God Wars Dungeon]].

The defensive bonuses of the halo are similar to those of a [[black full helm]], excluding negative attack bonuses and Ranged defence bonus. In addition, the halo gives a [[prayer bonus]] and magic defence while the full helm does not.

If the player dies below level 20 [[Wilderness]], it will remain in the player's inventory. However, the item will be unusable and must be repaired with 25,000 coins by using the item on [[Perdu]]. If not protected when the player dies above level 20 Wilderness, the item is converted into coins and dropped. Alternatively, a [[Trouver parchment]] and a payment of 500,000 coins can be given to [[Perdu]] in order to lock it (after which it gains the [[(l)]] suffix); this allows the item to be kept in death, unbroken, even if the player dies at level 20 Wilderness or higher.
